tweets.text:
Thank you to those who called us about an oil pollution on the River Dove near #Ashbourne #Derbyshire

We're working to locate the source & to minimise the impact on the #environment

If you have any information about this or to report any environmental incidents call 0800 807060 https://t.co/QLj8iBZx3H

Did you know a rainbow coloured film or thick sludge on the beach or in the sea can indicate oil #pollution? 🌈

If you spot oil, please report it to @EnvAgency & the  council, who will investigate & clean it up to protect wildlife ☎️🐟 

More info - https://t.co/jU6ZkFAPua https://t.co/FkTaDae7fN
I'm serious, I want a pint of whatever it is the @EnvAgency have been drinking. https://t.co/PAfJ1F8Au6

tweets.text: If you like watching how #pike #pikeperch #zander #barbel #shad or #lamprey move through an impounded #riversevern check out our animation https://t.co/xUHM7glqrY #fish #movement @CatieGR @Pete_Davies1 @SevernUnlocked @EnvAgencyMids @FishMigrationDr  @BU_Research & cast a vote! https://t.co/T4rc7ZdVhu

Today we have published our Regulating for People, the Environment and Growth report.

It shows the importance of regulation in allowing industry to thrive while protecting air, land and water. 

Read the full report here - https://t.co/qDmR5R6ZSy https://t.co/jvZwAb1Vd7

Check out the interactive version here for my entry!
https://t.co/vggfHPcT4Q https://t.co/OMywZxBi49
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/QOmgkXEuzs

@TheTiercel @JoKingDevon @EnvAgencySW @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice And these are just the ones I’ve found. I’m told the incident is under investigation by MCA. Whether they find the perpetrator(s) remains to be seen but whatever sanctions might be applied, it seems insignificant compared to the immeasurable cost to wildlife already struggling.

Sep 2020: A lost decade for nature. A depressing read. Gov talks a lot of positive rhetoric but no action to back it up. Funding for wildlife and environment ⬇️ by 30%. Habitats not created or managed properly. This must change! @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency  https://t.co/18apvQz5FE

@ArroJoanne @saveferriby2020 @joypenzer @Wykeland @XR_BSE @Natures_Voice @greenbeltsal @_BCT_ @WoodlandTrust @Swan_Rescue @YWT_North @RSPBbirders @YorksWildlife @HERGreens @East_Riding @yorkshirepost @NaturalEngland In this instance check with @Humberbeat. In light of the potentially endangered species there this needs criminal investigation particularly if planning permission has not been granted. Good luck.

@FerribyFOCUS @woodyroy @chrisywo @JoannaD47681349 #saveferriby #APerfectPlanet

urls.title: Thames Estuary 2100: 10-Year Review monitoring key findings
urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We’d like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services. We also use cookies set by other sites to help us deliver content from their services. Where we have identified any third party copyright information you will need to obtain permission from the copyright holders concerned. This publication is available at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/thames-estuary-2100-te2100/tha

tweets.text:
Today @EnvAgency launches its 10 yr monitoring report into #ClimateEmergency related changes to the #Thames Estuary. By incorporating findings to the @TE2100Plan we are adapting to a more #ClimateResilient future. #TogetherForOurPlanet #RaceToResilience

entity.name: The Last Leg
entity.description: `The Last Leg' had its first leg as a late-night show during the 2012 Paralympics, and it was a critically acclaimed run for hosts Adam Hills, Alex Brooker and Josh Widdecombe. Now the threesome return to C4 screens to tackle the issues of the week with intelligent and alternative commentary, joined by a live studio audience and celebrity guests. The programme also sees the return of the popular `Is It OK?' segment, and home viewers and the studio audience are encouraged to ask this question about anything from the week, without fear of judgement.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Probably says 'Tut tut!' and has a Zoom meeting to discuss the positioning of the chairs?
Treasury / Defra must be behind this...?

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

tweets.text:
Me: So @EnvAgency, why have you taken pollution incidents and a target to reduce them out of your performance reports?
EA: We'll get back to you on that.
Me: *twiddles thumbs*
Me: Helloooo? Is anyone there?
EA:🤐
https://t.co/Tqd9MZUd24

Still no comment from the @EnvAgency 
I'm chasing... https://t.co/wxlbcpP8RE

@JamesBevanEA Agree, but the results in the report show a disturbing 'hands-off' trend of inaction, which makes the @EnvAgency look increasingly ineffective. Reasons? Impossible to believe due to improved environmental behaviour. EA funding and staff cuts? https://t.co/O1okhgcLWc
@JoKingDevon @EnvAgencySW @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice No reply from @CwallWildlife but I’ll email that address. Thanks 👍🏼

They finally got back to me to say that serious pollution incidents won't appear in the reports all year; they can switch which measures to include; the measures in the latest report are in line with its new 5-year plan. Pretty sure that's going to raise a few eyebrows. https://t.co/LF4wBx1FId

urls.title: thames estuary levels changing | University of Southampton
urls.description: Sea Levels In The Thames Estuary Are Rising Faster Now Than Ever Before, According To A Report Released Today By The Environment Agency, With Contributions From The University Of Southampton

tweets.text:
A team from @OceanEarthUoS helped produce the new @EnvAgency study that shows sea levels in the Thames Estuary are rising faster now than ever before.

Read about the @TE2100Plan report here: 

https://t.co/waaqLex4Nu https://t.co/SkPA0I3Kpm

This was a really useful discussion and will lead to worthwhile collaboration between @EnvAgency and @NatPrepCom on how we build resilience and preparedness for cities and other localities. https://t.co/0sMUPlt4UN

tweets.text: This week @northyorkmoors have planted 500 trees in Danby Dale as part of the #WEG Esk Restoration Project. The trees will help reduce sediment & runoff from the land, improving water quality AND will create new woodland habitat. 🌳👍 @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/9mQNMIgMi4
I think the need for stronger regulation is clear but who can deliver it? @EnvAgency? https://t.co/gTaXapFcoI via @businessgreen

Repair works on the River Alt @LuntMeadows have continued to progress well. The helicopter 🚁has been on site this week to place the bags of aggregate that will be used to fix the breach. 

Read more about our response to last month’s floods ⬇️

https://t.co/5v1GOUIPv1 https://t.co/5bXJR3C6v2

I was asked how ready is the UK to deal with the impact of climate change? Answer: not ready enough. But if we do the right things we can be. Runaway climate change won’t just kill the insurance industry, though it will. It will kill our economy, our people and our planet. https://t.co/OdEuh6KLJx
